page.title: 14Chief Scout visits Kent
page.content:
On Sunday{2nd June 1985}the{Chief {Scout, Major-General Michael Walsh, {C.B., D.S.O.}came to his Scouts and Cubs in Kent on a{flying visit.
Every{Scout Troop}in{North West Kent was{camping}at{Brands Hatch}over the weekend of 1st/2nd June and{Cub Packs came out{for the day}on Sunday. The {Chief Scout}arrived by{helicopter}and spent a couple of hours touring the various campsites and chatting to the boys. Leaders were kept in the background. The{Chief Scout}later pronounced his{delight}at the{happy, {disciplined}and{competant nature}of the{boys}he met and of their{high {camping standards.
The Chief Scout is a very busy man and such a visit is a rare occurance in the Scouting Calendar.
